intro: Buglossum vulgare, commonly known as common bugloss, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, often thriving in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are arranged in dense spikes. Buglossum vulgare is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally for its potential health benefits.
